title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.16 | 30-10-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session we will be discussing from the 16th verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker begins with prayers and introduces the topic of discussion: verse 1.6.16 of Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: As soon as I began to meditate upon the lotus feet of the Personality of Godhead, with my mind transformed in transcendental Love â€¦. Tears rolled down my eyes and without delay the personality of Godhead Shri Krishna appeared on the lotus of my heart.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of the verse, describing Narada Muni's experience of meditating on Krishna and the appearance of the Lord in his heart.

segments.key_quote: Narada Muni experienced what is called as Bhava. Bhava is the mind transformed in transcendental love for the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Narada Muni's meditation on the Supersoul and the changes that occur as meditation progresses, leading to Bhava, or transcendental love.

segments.key_quote: Bhakti begins with Shraddha...transcendental faith...that this process of bhakti is bona fide, authentic, and will lead to the highest perfection if followed systematically, requiring guidance by a bona fide spiritual master.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the beginning of Bhakti with Shraddha (faith) and the importance of a bona fide spiritual master for guidance.

segments.key_quote: Shraddha leads to sadhu sangha associating with like-minded devotees...then bhajana kriya...the standard activities especially the initiation the deeksha initiation from the bona fide spiritual master.
segments.summary: The speaker continues describing the steps of Bhakti, including association with devotees (sadhu-sangha), engaging in devotional activities (bhajana kriya), and receiving initiation (diksha) from a spiritual master in the parampara system.

segments.key_quote: That leads to Anartha Nivritti, the fourth step...cleansing the heart of all kinds of misgivings...And when Anartha Nivritti has sufficiently happened...then there is nishtha. One becomes fixed up in the practice of devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Anartha Nivritti (cleansing of misgivings) and Nishtha (fixed devotion) as steps in the process of Bhakti.

segments.key_quote: Then the sixth step from nishtha at progresses to the six step, it's called Ruchi...one develops spiritual taste...and the seventh step is what is called as asakti attachment.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Ruchi (spiritual taste) and Asakti (attachment) as further steps in the development of Bhakti.

segments.key_quote: Then the 8th step is bhava...the stage where one experiences transcendental ecstasy...and Narada Muni...he came to the stage of bhava where he began to experience ecstasy within.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Bhava (transcendental ecstasy) and describes the symptoms of ecstasy, referencing Narada Muni's experience.

segments.key_quote: I'll stop here thank you very much Hare Krishna
